answers.answer: Possibly SPD or pelvic girdle pain Google them and see if you have the symptoms I didn't have it on my first but I did with my 2nd you should mention it to your doc or when your at your next hospital appointment and they can offer you to see physio therapist who will give you advice on what things you can and can't do also provide you with a maternity belt which supports bump relieving pressure of your pelvis
Have u had a change in discharge since the pressure or any wetness

I'm 35 weeks & started have LOTS of pelvic pressure around 25-27 weeks & my doctor said that it's your baby pressing on a bunch of nerves down there that make it hurt & your hips/pelvic bone are preparing for labor & that's why you have those pains

question: Wondering if anyone can help with any advice!?I'm currently 25+5 weeks and i'm currently having really bad pelvic pressure quite low down it's just started since i've been sat here watching tv!I'm waiting for a glucose test at the hospital because my midwife reckons I could have gestational diabetes too!They're getting really uncomfortable now and i can barely move if I go to change position because it just hurts me and is really uncomfortable!My partners not home either so just looking for some advice before I ring him to come back hahaha!
title: pelvic pressure
